duties_responsibilities.duty: Analyze and develop solutions to facility and test modifications, upgrades, repair, and maintenance.

Provide facility and test cell design support, facility project management, scheduling of outside contractors and vendors, investigation and adherence to building codes, project cost estimates, and assistance in planning of expansion projects.

Establish budgets, provide schedules and technical solutions utilizing both internal and external resources. This would include Architects, engineers, and contractors. Manage project implementation by bidding projects, awarding contracts, and managing contractors during construction. Ensure all contractors follow safety regulations.

Work with internal customers to develop project requirements and specifications that will be used for bidding purposes. Provide solutions to a variety of facility issues related to the expansion or alteration of the facility and equipment in the facility.
Communicate with maintenance groups and contractors to ensure operating procedures, building, equipment, and systems contribute to continuous operational up-time.
Participate in continuous improvement efforts by initiating and recommending changes to resolve problems or make improvements.

education_certification.credential: Currently in the process of obtaining a 4-year or advanced degree in Industrial, Mechanical, or Electrical Engineering, Science, Technology, or other relevant degree. Overall GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
Relocation: Partial relocation assistance is provided.
Visa Sponsorship is not available for this position.
This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as, H, L, TN, F, J, E, O.
EEO/AA Employer. All qualified individuals - Including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply.
